detail.content_1: I worked within the Customer Acquisitions and Loyalty team and our charge was the MyChrono section of the website. This was the area that users interacted with the most and hosted a number of special features built specifically for them.
detail.content_2: One of these features was the Watchcollection area. Here the user could add watches they already owned as well as having the collection automatically update when a watch was purchased through the Chrono24 platform.

detail.content_1: I led the team and created all the principal UI design work for the design system being built for what is called the Reservix Core system.
detail.content_2: Creating a system that is easier to hand over to the developers was a challenge as I was transitioning from Sketch into Figma. Figmaâ€™s dev mode had not yet been released so manually ruling out all spacing was the most effective way to make the designs clear for the developers.

vacc.position: Website Designer, Developer and Team Leader
vacc.title: Victorian Automobile Chamber of Commerce

detail.content_1: One of the various website designs I've done for VACC Members, this site for Des Brown's Service Centre was crying out for some retro style.
detail.content_2: Another website for a VACC member. Nippon Truck Services had a particular style with their logo that they required the site to follow.

detail.content_1: I was asked to create a logo design for the RSPCA's Campaign Hero initiative. I went through many different iterations before settling on this shield-based design. A Campaign Hero is the shield for the animals they care for.
detail.content_2: Being present during the overhaul of the RSPCA Victoria website I worked on many projects. Wrestling with their CMS (RadEditor) I managed quite a few content updates, as well as designs for custom pages.
